clump.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: a group of trees, bushes, or other plants growing very close together
clump.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: The roses were planted in clumps across the park.
clump.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: a small mass of something such as earth or mud
clump.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: the sound of someone walking with heavy steps
clump.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: I heard the clump of Ralphâ€™s boots going up the stairs.
clump.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: to walk with slow noisy steps
clump.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: The kids clumped up the stairs in their boots.
clump.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: if separate objects clump together, or are clumped together, they form a group or solid mass
clump.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: Hair and soap had clumped together in the drain.
